database.name: AzureSynapse
database.remote_description: The Host is the Dedicated SQL Endpoint from the Synapse Workspace. Click for details.

database.name: Elasticsearch
database.local_description: Install the HTTPS certificate as described in help
database.remote_description: Install the HTTPS certificate as described in help

database.name: Oracle
database.local_description: Choose different connection methods (SID, TNS or Service Name) from the URL combo.
database.remote_description: Choose to connect via SID, Service Name or TNS from the URL combo.
database.cloud_description: Use 'jdbc:oracle:thin:@' + the URL from the Cloud Console as described here.

database.name: PostgreSQL
database.remote_description: Require enabling remote connectivity in Postgres and the Windows firewall.

database.name: MongoDb
database.local_description: The URL is the same as the native Java URL. Choose 'Manual Edit' in the URL combo.
database.remote_description: The URL is the same as the native Java URL. Choose 'Manual Edit' in the URL combo.

database.name: DocumentDB
database.remote_description: Create a SSH Tunnel.

database.name: MySql
database.remote_description: May require to enable remote connectivity in MySql and the Windows firewall.

database.name: MariaDb
database.remote_description: May require to configure remote connectivity and the Windows firewall.

database.name: SingleStore
database.remote_description: May require to configure remote connectivity and the Windows firewall.

database.name: AuroraMySql
database.remote_description: Choose 'Manually Edit' in the URL combo and copy it from the AWS console.

database.name: Cassandra
database.local_description: Find the DataCenter using 'nodetool status' or 'nodetool -h ::FFFF:127.0.0.1 status'
database.remote_description: Find the DataCenter using 'nodetool status' or 'nodetool -h ::FFFF:127.0.0.1 status'

database.name: Databricks
database.local_description: If Databricks is in the cloud, choose 'Manually Edit' in the URL combo and copy the URL from the Cloud Console.
database.remote_description: For cloud installations choose 'Manually Edit' in the URL combo and copy the URL from the Cloud Console.

database.name: Hive
database.remote_description: Choose different authentication methods from the URL combo.

driver.description: Using Kerberos - Requires more steps, please read the Help

database.name: HBase
database.local_description: Read the help about how to install Phoenix in HBase server and use the matching client to your server version.
database.remote_description: Install Phoenix in HBase as described in Help. Check the JDBC driver to match your HBase version.

database.name: Redshift
database.remote_description: Choose 'Manually Edit' in the URL combo and copy the URL from the cloud console.

database.name: Salesforce
database.local_description: Append to the password the Token generated on the Salesforce website.Details in Help.
database.remote_description: The host can be login.salesforce.com, {your-domain}.sandbox.lightning.force.com, etc.

database.name: SqlServer
database.local_description: JDBC require to enable TCP/IP communication in SqlServer. Click for details.
database.remote_description: JDBC require to enable TCP/IP in SqlServer and configure the Windows Firewall. The host is the DNS name or IP (not the Windows computer name).

driver.description: Active Directory with User and Password

database.name: AzureSQL
database.remote_description: Choose 'Manually Edit' in the URL combo and copy the URL from the Azure console.

database.name: SqlServerBefore2006
database.remote_description: Enable TCP/IP in the SqlServer and the Windows Firewall. The host is the DNS name or IP.

database.name: SAPAdaptiveServer
database.local_description: Enable TCP/IP in the database server
database.remote_description: Enable TCP/IP in the database server and the Windows firewall.

database.name: SqlAnywhere
database.local_description: Please start the Network Server in the SQL Central
database.remote_description: Please start the Network Server in the SQL Central and configure the Windows firewall.

database.name: CSVFiles
database.local_description: Learn about the CSV formats in Help. Choose to load a single CSV file or multiple files from the JDBC URL combo.

database.name: HSql
database.description: Choose File/Remote Connection. Open OpenOffice (.odt) with file pointing to the folder/databaseName.

database.name: Snowflake
database.remote_description: Set the Host as '<SNOWFLAKE-ACCOUNT>.<REGION>.snowflakecomputing.com'. If possible, choose the database and the warehouse, to avoid errors later.

database.name: GoogleBigQuery
database.remote_description: For setting custom host or port choose 'Manually Edit' in the URL combo.

database.name: GoogleCloudSpanner
database.remote_description: Configure GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS variable as described in 'Help & Tips'. Credential path with backslash (Windows) or slash (Linux)

database.name: ScyllaDB
database.local_description: Find the DataCenter using 'nodetool status' or 'nodetool -h ::FFFF:127.0.0.1 status'
database.remote_description: Find the DataCenter using 'nodetool status' or 'nodetool -h ::FFFF:127.0.0.1 status'
